intro: Urvillea rufescens, commonly known as the red-barked urvillea, is a shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems that develop a reddish-brown bark. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Urvillea rufescens is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas.
